messages.photo: (File not included. Change data exporting settings to download.)
messages.text: For example, I have this NFT that displays NEAR price data and updates every 3 mins. Would be really cool to have NFTs like this displaying in VR and maybe as people interacted with the NFT, instead of "BUY" they could have a "deposit" interaction or "stake"

Then, in VR, the graph could update to show the new balance of the vault (lets say this NFT was displaying the balance of a DAO treasury) or could show variation in earning/rewards (assuming the NFT was displaying LP/yield farming earnings)
NFT's are hard to look at in the wallet, but having a VR collection of DeFi NFTs that displayed Vault/Position values in real time seems pretty useful

If you'd like to try it out: "try to send 1 NEAR to usd.widget.near, you will receive a NFT with actual NEAR/USD ratio which is available in wallet (updates once per 3 minutes) built by johnnydoe.near"

text: Happy friday everyone! Just wanted to give a new update on this

and myself had a talk this week and we would like to move forward with this. We will figure out a rough roadmap soon. Given that the project might have a big focus on research & color preception in general and as DAO structures are recomendable, we were considering of starting a DAO specifically for that and collaborate/request funds from the VR DAO. What do you think?
also has some thoughts to add to it i believe

messages.text: I think it's awesome!
I talked to the pidgeon on wednesday and I'm into all the ideas i heard, let's go!

Yes i do thanks T & F ! We believe a DAO focused on colour research might bring additional traction and material to the VR DAO. While some artists are interested in VR, pretty much all of them are interested in Colour...
üíú

messages.file: (File not included. Change data exporting settings to download.)
messages.thumbnail: (File not included. Change data exporting settings to download.)

messages.text: We thought a good starting point might be a blog where members of the Colour  DAO would be encouraged to publish articles about their own reflections and theories on colour. The VR DAO can then use this as a roadmap and fish ideas to execute in actual VR environments.

As i said to Tolga and say it here: the VR DAO is really trying to become a force in the ecosystem; that means not only being a platform for funding, obviously, but most importantly, we want to be a receptive DAO, a sensible DAO, and really push the envelope on whats being done in Vr, of course, but also in art and technology.
The idea of an investigative platform that, in turn, feeds VR projects seems incredible to me; that platform can publish texts from artists, writers, painters, computer scientists, etc

text: Hey all! we are working on this proposal and any comment about it would be very appreciated

messages.text:
I will dig in a little bit deeper but upon a quick look I think it would be more appropriate for proposals above the 5k/mo limit to be general proposals for/to the creatives DAO and not specifically for/to the VR DAO. 

In practice, this would mean that the proposal would be submitted to the creatives DAO, not the VR DAO, and would be worked through based on a creatives DAO budget. 

In general I feel as though dev related bounties/proposals that support the entire creative ecosystem should probably be going to the creatives DAO instead of specific creative DAOs, and dev related bounties/proposals that are more guild/community specific should stay within their guild/communities as proposals. 

Once these proposals are APPROVED by the Creatives DAO, then individual guilds could put up specific bounties to incentivize those devs to work on projects that support their guilds specifically.

So, this would mean that Tabea, Vandal, JM, myself, (and not really Rebecca but she will still be on council for now) would be evaluating the need of these devs within the community and arguably the proposal would be outside of the scope of the 5k budget for guilds specifically. Imo the 5k budget should continue to focus on distributing incentives to guild/community members for their own projects/ideas and this should free up funding for that üëåüèΩ
it seems perfectly reasonable to me; would you say that the 2500$ we are allocating to the one Dev can also follow that system in the future?
yes, I definitely think that $2500/mo for dev bountys from October and moving forward is reasonable
ok
Would be good to start thinking of multiple dev roles that the entire creative community think are important and these can become rolling bounties for the Creatives DAO in general
that way it can be shared with NDC participants, hackathon contributors, and other devs within (and outside of) the NEAR community üëåüèΩ
yeah that seems great!
Since the VR DAO has already 2 roles (1 approved and the 1 we're discussing now) that would fit that description, we can help in imagining the context in which it's applied moving forward

This is great. I believe a good general pipeline would be to have: 1 dev for platforms (library adaptation for all os/devices), 1 dev for interaction design, 1 dev for shaders and parametric design, and 1 dev for sound design. One extra dev that would be super cool, is 1 for haptics implementation, which is great in terms of inclusion
Thanks so much for sharing, always love listening to Jaron, this touched on so many things I am into right now, great podcast (although the intro was a bit strange üòÇ)

messages.text: Should we close them and give feedback (and possibly rewards) on the submissions? Should they remain open? If so, for how long? I feel it's important we have a plan about this.

text: hey ppl. If you could pls rt with comment

messages.text: Ok! Perfect! it would also be great to have feedback for the previous submissions; some are from end of august/beginning of september, a long time has passed. Negative feedback is better than no feedback, in my mind; that way members of the community know if they have to rewrite it, or if they don't have the necessary knowledge for the completion of the bounty, or if they misunderstood the scope of the bounty. It might be a good idea to clarify our position by replying to each submission (maybe after the scope of the bounty is a bit more clear in our heads).

It is also advisable that we are flexible with rewards; if someone didn't exactly presented what we are looking for, we still can check if their contributions has valor, and if so, a % of the bounty reward can be given (with great care, of course, so that the $ for the bounty doesn't run out).

This is very good. I think it‚Äôd be much better if contributors are aware of the current situation of events around their contributions/submissions to help them resubmit or edit in case they didn‚Äôt really understand the scope or for other basic reasons.
yeah, agree. We are working on it! And feel free, always, to state your opinion on any matter. The work we're doing aims to be completely transparent to all community members.

messages.text: When I tried creating a coop on testnet it has the "Everyone" group hidden. Curious why it was shown for you.

The purpose for having "everyone" as a group is to be able to set permissions for what anyone with a near name can do. For example, in a coop, only people who are explicitly part of a group can make proposals. On testnet, that's how the coop I made is behaving. 

But in the VR DAO on mainnet, I was able to make a proposal to it as someone who was not explicitly in a group. I think that is because the default rules for everyone has been overwritten by a group named "everyone" with some people in it, so there are not rules explicitly stated for "everyone", so it falls to default behavior defined in code (let everyone submit). I'll have to look at the configuration state using CLI to verify but that's my first thought. Sorry for the wall of text.

messages.photo: (File not included. Change data exporting settings to download.)

messages.text: the 'council' group was never on the preset, so should i create it (and remove the members from the 'everyone' group?
ah, and in the voting policy the only option is 'everyone'; would there be a 'council' option if that group is created?
+, jordan, can u vote on ur own proposal?
Yes, when you create the group it becomes an option.

I created the proposal to test if I could vote. I can not, which is a good thing. My concern is "everyone" having power to create a proposal + "everyone" having the power to vote would be an easy way to drain funds
this is the testnet coop i made where i can't add proposals as "everyone"
ok. If i create the council group, and change the voting policy for council only, then it would be solved, correct?

That would be the safest, yes. Right now it seems like the configuration is safe but it's that way because of code defaults. If you upgrade the DAO and code defaults change you could be opening yourself up to exploit.

Then I will change it. When i created the dao i found strange that were no council option, but assumed creating a new group would be some sort of division between members, like council 1 (with specific voting powers), council 2, etc
do you know if i can, when creating a group, add several members at once?

currently it's single member at once. we're looking at the best way to implement multi member add (multicall for each or improving the smart contract itself).

take care that when adding members, it's best to create the proposal for a single member and vote them in before making the next proposal. this is because a snapshot of governance is taken when the proposal is made. if changes happen in between the proposal being made and passed those changes will be overwritten.
ok
thx!
üëÄüëÄüëÄüëÄ
if its nDAI should be on astro, already... We will try to fix this issue today (a few votes are needed so that might take just a bit of time)

Awesome, thank you! And when voting people in, it's best to do the proposal then immediately pass it (for each person). It takes more patience but is easier to see what's going on. 

When a proposal is made it snapshots the governance state. Any proposals that pass in between the proposal snapshot and it passing will be overwritten üò¨
ok; understood.
Sure
